elements.name: landIntroExplanation
elements.title:
It's time to enter information about any land or buildings that {deceasedName} owned in British Columbia.

If {deceasedName} owned any land or buildings, make sure you have the Land Title Certificate(s) to help fill in the information.

elements.name: landExists
elements.title: Did {deceasedName} own any land or buildings in BC at the time of their death?
elements.description: You do not need to include land or buildings outside of British Columbia

elements.name: landExistsFAQ
elements.title: What if the deceased owns real estate that is not in British Columbia?
elements.body: You do not need to list real estate that is not in British Columbia. These are not within the jurisdiction of the Supreme Court of BC.  <– needs rephrasing, "jurisdiction of supreme court..." doesn't really mean anything to the user.

elements.name: question373
elements.title: manufactured homes, also know as mobile homes or trailer homes. don't include here. there will be questions later.
elements.body: You do not need to list real estate that is not in British Columbia. These are not within the jurisdiction of the Supreme Court of BC.  <– needs rephrasing, "jurisdiction of supreme court..." doesn't really mean anything to the user.

elements.name: landExistsYesExplanation
elements.title:
Please use some of the documents listed below to answer the questions.
Land Title Certificate
An official document issued by the Land Title and Survey Authority.
Mortgage Statements
Details the outstanding value of a mortgage for the real estate.
Property Tax Statements
Details the amount of property tax that needs to be paid for the real estate.

templateElements.name: landAdress
templateElements.title: What is the address of this land or building? (Province and Country shouldn't be here - maybe greyed out)

templateElements.name: question442
templateElements.title: [JIRA] Connect to BC Assessment's website to fill in fields

templateElements.name: question29
templateElements.title:
[Nov 10 2020 - old notes from qualifying]
* Dispute - Estate and Applicant Q’s
* Issue if there is a dispute who is the “real” owner of the estate
* Eg. Spouse name is not on title but has lived there for 70yrs
* Does everyone agree to the names of the owners for the estate?
Scenario - House Rich Cash Poor wife - not enough distribution for children
Likely not happening as part of the application, usually after during distribution [check with VLC/Chilliwack for frequency]

templateElements.name: landSoleOwner
templateElements.title: On the Land Title, is on {deceasedName} the only registered owner of {panel.landAddress}?

templateElements.name: landOwnershipType
templateElements.visibleIf: {panel.landSoleOwner} = 'n'
templateElements.title: What type of ownership is {panel.landAddress} registered under?

templateElements.name: landCommonPercent
templateElements.visibleIf: {panel.landSoleOwner} = 'n' and {panel.landOwnershipType} = 'common'
templateElements.title: What % of {address} did deceased own? (how many sig figs for 1/3 = 33.33%?)
templateElements.description: usually specified in the Land Title. If not, assume an equal split with other Tenants in Common

templateElements.name: landJointAlive
templateElements.visibleIf: {panel.landOwnershipType} = 'joint'
templateElements.title: Are any of the other registered owners alive?

templateElements.name: landJointAliveYesExplanation
templateElements.visibleIf: {panel.landOwnershipType} = 'joint' and {panel.landJointAlive} = 'y'
templateElements.title: Because another joint tenant of {panel.landAddress} is alive, this land or building passes to them automatically and you do not need to manage it as part of {deceasedName}'s estate.

templateElements.name: landJointDiedAfter
templateElements.visibleIf: {panel.landOwnershipType} = 'joint' and {panel.landJointAlive} = 'n'
templateElements.title: Did any other registered owners of {panel.address} die after [Date of Death + 4 days]?

templateElements.name: landJointDiedAfterFAQ
templateElements.visibleIf: {panel.landOwnershipType} = 'joint' and {panel.landJointAlive} = 'n'
templateElements.title: Why does this date matter?

templateElements.name: landJointDiedAfterYesExplanation
templateElements.visibleIf: {panel.landOwnershipType} = 'joint' and {panel.landJointAlive} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfter} = y
templateElements.title: Because one or more joint tenants of {panel.landAddress} has died after {deceased}, this land or building passed to them automatically and you do not need to manage it as part of {deceasedName}'s estate.

templateElements.name: question325
templateElements.title: [If there was a will - maybe include this is the blue info box by duplicating info boxes for will vs no will] Was this {address} listed in {decasedName}'s Will as a gift?

templateElements.name: question335
templateElements.title: is this still part of {deceasedName}'s estate?
templateElements.description:
yes - still include in P10 but say "this asset is dealt with outside of their estate";
no - P10 text "this asset was not in their estate at time of death"

templateElements.name: landJointDiedAfterNoExplanation
templateElements.visibleIf: {panel.landOwnershipType} = 'joint' and {panel.landJointAlive} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfter} = 'n'
templateElements.title: Because {decasedName} is considered the last surviving joint tenant of {panel.landAddress}, it needs to be managed as part of {deceasedName}'s estate.

templateElements.name: question361
templateElements.title: registered owners that died within 4 days, how many? divide the P10 value by amount of owners (add note saying, deceased owned 50% of $20,000 car)

templateElements.name: landNameMatch
templateElements.visibleIf:
{panel.landSoleOwner} = 'y' or ({panel.landSoleOwner} = 'n' and 
({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'common' 
or ({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'joint' and {panel.landJointAlive} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfter} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfterNoExplanation} >0)))
templateElements.title: On the land title for {panel.address}, is {deceasedName}'s name written exactly as {deceasedName}?

templateElements.name: landAlias
templateElements.visibleIf:
{panel.landSoleOwner} = 'y' or ({panel.landSoleOwner} = 'n' and 
({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'common' 
or ({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'joint' and {panel.landJointAlive} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfter} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfterNoExplanation} >0))) and {panel.landNameMatch} = 'n'
templateElements.title: full name if not a match

templateElements.name: landPID
templateElements.visibleIf:
{panel.landSoleOwner} = 'y' or ({panel.landSoleOwner} = 'n' and 
({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'common' 
or ({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'joint' and {panel.landJointAlive} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfter} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfterNoExplanation} >0)))
templateElements.title: Please enter the parcel identifier (PID) of the real estate.
templateElements.description: 3 x 3-digit boxes

templateElements.name: question317
templateElements.visibleIf:
{panel.landSoleOwner} = 'y' or ({panel.landSoleOwner} = 'n' and 
({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'common' 
or ({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'joint' and {panel.landJointAlive} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfter} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfterNoExplanation} >0)))
templateElements.title: Where can I go to find this information?
templateElements.body: You can find the legal description in the land title under the section Description of Land beneath the parcel identifier. Another way to find this is to enter the address of the real estate into the BC assessment website.

templateElements.name: landLegalDescription
templateElements.visibleIf:
{panel.landSoleOwner} = 'y' or ({panel.landSoleOwner} = 'n' and 
({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'common' 
or ({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'joint' and {panel.landJointAlive} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfter} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfterNoExplanation} >0)))
templateElements.title: Please enter the legal description of the real estate.

templateElements.name: landValue
templateElements.visibleIf:
{panel.landSoleOwner} = 'y' or ({panel.landSoleOwner} = 'n' and 
({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'common' 
or ({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'joint' and {panel.landJointAlive} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfter} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfterNoExplanation} >0)))
templateElements.title: How much was this place worth on {deceasedDateOfDeath}?

choices.text: I don't know right now but I can get it later

templateElements.name: landValueFAQ
templateElements.visibleIf:
{panel.landSoleOwner} = 'y' or ({panel.landSoleOwner} = 'n' and 
({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'common' 
or ({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'joint' and {panel.landJointAlive} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfter} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfterNoExplanation} >0)))
templateElements.title: How do I value the house?
templateElements.body:
Fact 1: Probate fees amount X%. Fact 2: Capital gains is your regular income tax bracket for 50% of the earnings on top of what it was worth. 
Variable 1: capital gains may not matter if the people inheriting the house are planning on moving in and declaring it their primary residence. 
you might want to get professional advice?

templateElements.name: landValueMethod
templateElements.visibleIf:
{panel.landSoleOwner} = 'y' or ({panel.landSoleOwner} = 'n' and 
({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'common' 
or ({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'joint' and {panel.landJointAlive} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfter} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfterNoExplanation} >0)))
templateElements.title: method of valuation

templateElements.name: question330
templateElements.title: What is the value of the furniture and other household items at {address}?

templateElements.name: landMortgageExists
templateElements.visibleIf:
{panel.landSoleOwner} = 'y' or ({panel.landSoleOwner} = 'n' and 
({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'common' 
or ({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'joint' and {panel.landJointAlive} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfter} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfterNoExplanation} >0)))
templateElements.title: Mortgage? (in deceased's name)
templateElements.description: Mortgage lenders don't want to be notified (they don't feel the need to object to the application)

templateElements.visibleIf:
{panel.landSoleOwner} = 'y' or ({panel.landSoleOwner} = 'n' and 
({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'common' 
or ({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'joint' and {panel.landJointAlive} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfter} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfterNoExplanation} >0))) and {panel.landMortgageExists} = 'y'

templateElements.name: landMortgageLenderName
templateElements.title: who is the mortgage lender? (who are the payments going to?)
templateElements.description: financial institution or full name of private mortgage lender

templateElements.name: landMortgageLenderAddress
templateElements.title: mortgage lender's address

templateElements.name: landMortgageLenderAddressFAQ
templateElements.title: There are many different addresses? Which one should I use?
templateElements.body: Look for any statements the deceased may have received about the mortgage. The statements usually include an address which you can enter here.

templateElements.name: landMortgageNumber
templateElements.title: mortgage registration number

templateElements.name: question3
templateElements.title: date reigstered??

templateElements.name: landMortgageNameMatch
templateElements.title: On mortgage # {mortgagenumber}, is {deceasedName}'s name written exactly as {deceasedName}?

templateElements.name: landMortgageAlias
templateElements.title: name on mortgage

templateElements.name: landMortgageValue
templateElements.title: How much was this mortgage worth on {deceasedDateOfDeath}? For [street address] on [Mortgage #]
templateElements.description: This is tricky. Ask mortgage lender for the actual date of death, not simply was is on the closest statement to date of the death - Maybe DDRs can relax this??

choices.text: I don't know right now but I can get it later
the mortgage lender will not give me this information

templateElements.name: landTaxExists
templateElements.visibleIf:
{panel.landSoleOwner} = 'y' or ({panel.landSoleOwner} = 'n' and 
({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'common' 
or ({panel.landOwnershipType} = 'joint' and {panel.landJointAlive} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfter} = 'n' and {panel.landJointDiedAfterNoExplanation} >0)))
templateElements.title: Is there Property tax deferment?
templateElements.description: must be formal agreement, not just late taxes.

templateElements.name: landTaxCity
templateElements.title: what is the city that the property tax is owed [can we auto-detect city by address?]
templateElements.description: municipality

templateElements.name: landTaxAddress
templateElements.title: municipality's [city hall] address

templateElements.name: landTaxNumber
templateElements.title: property tax agreement number [Provincial or municipality?]

templateElements.name: question4
templateElements.title: date started? do we need this? do we need a range?

templateElements.name: landTaxNameMatch
templateElements.title: On property tax deferment # {propertytaxnumber}, is {deceasedName}'s name written exactly as {deceasedName}?

templateElements.name: landTaxAlias
templateElements.title: name on property tax agreement

templateElements.name: landTaxValue
templateElements.title: How much was this property tax worth on {deceasedDateOfDeath}? For [street address] on [Mortgage #]
templateElements.description: interest is probably charged annually? so pick the last "statement" before they died.

choices.text: I don't know right now but I can get it later
the {city/municipality} will not give me this information

elements.name: question394
elements.title: secured line of credit? [Dani says yes - Tyler says applicable for all other things as well]

elements.name: question340
elements.title:
Understanding land title certificates
A land title certificate contains a lot of information about a real estate. Here are some of the areas you may find useful for completing the questions. Registered Owner in Fee Simple Shows the owner(s) of the real estate. Taxation Authority
The one receiving property taxes on the real estate
Description of Land
Contains legal description about the real estate.
Charges, Liens and Interests
Lists any mortgages, liens or money owing on the property.
